page.title: 14FELBRIGG HALL
page.content: Felbrigg Hall was built between 1621 and 1624. The West Wing was added in the 1680's. 23 of it's rooms are open to the public, and it also has a tea room, restaurant, and a gift shop. The Hall was taken over by the {National Trust}in 1969, when its last owner died. The{Felbrigg Estate covers 526 hectares, of which 240 are woodland. There is a walled garden, which has a dovecote, and greenhouses. As well as the main rooms, there are some secret passages, and a priest hole. The Hall also displays many works of art, and antiques. It gets most of its visitors in the summer, and there are guides in each room, telling the visitors about the history of items in the room. Christmas trees grown in the grounds are sold from December 1st each year.
